perturbation.original_text: "Gross Revenues" means the gross revenues received by the Licensee and derived from or in connection with the Licensee Site, from any sources whatsoever, including but not limited to fees for access to and use of the Licensee Site and advertising, sponsorship, marketing and other paid-for placements, andmaintenance, support and other services.
perturbation.changed_text: "Gross Revenues" means the net revenues received by the Licensee and derived only from direct subscription fees for access to and use of the Licensee Site. Advertising, sponsorship, marketing and other paid-for placements, and maintenance, support and other services are specifically excluded.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of "Gross Revenues" has been narrowed to "net revenues" and limited to only subscription fees, excluding advertising and other revenue streams. This contradicts standard accounting practices and could lead to disputes over royalty calculations, making enforcement uncertain.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and potential breach of contract related to revenue calculation.

perturbation.original_text: "Confidential Information" means any information that is treated as confidential by a party, including, without limitation, trade secrets, technology, information pertaining to business operations and strategies, and information pertaining to customers, pricing and marketing, in each case to the extent it is: (a) if in tangible form, marked as confidential; or otherwise, identified at the time of disclosure as confidential, or (b) would be considered as confidential information by one who is reasonably knowledgeable and experienced in the field to which the information relates. With respect to each party, the terms of this Agreement are Confidential Information of the other party.
perturbation.changed_text: "Confidential Information" means only information explicitly marked as "Confidential" at the time of disclosure. Information pertaining to business operations and strategies are not considered confidential. With respect to each party, only the specific financial terms of this Agreement are Confidential Information of the other party.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Confidential Information' has been significantly restricted. Removing 'information pertaining to business operations and strategies' and limiting the confidentiality of the Agreement to 'specific financial terms' contradicts common practices and legal precedents regarding trade secrets and confidential business information. This creates ambiguity and reduces the scope of protection, affecting enforceability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trade Secret Law, specifically regarding the definition of what constitutes a trade secret and confidential business information.

perturbation.original_text: 3.1 Content License. Subject to Licensee’s on­going compliance with Section 3.2 and all other terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor grants to Licensee an exclusive (save for rights reserved to Licensor hereunder), non-transferable (except as provided in Section 11.7) and non-sublicensable license, during the License Term, to reproduce, perform, display, transmit and distribute the Licensed Content on the Licensee Siteand Related Media intended solely for use by End Usersin the Territory within the scope set forth in Schedule 1 (License Scope), which is attached hereto and incorporated herein by this reference. The foregoing includes the right to permit End Users to access the Licensed Content solely for their own end use and not for redistribution and otherwise subject to Terms of Use that comply with Section 4.3. Licensee is not granted any right to, and shall not, permit any other use of the Licensed Content by End Users, or any use of the Licensed Content by any other Person (including Licensee's Affiliates).
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1 Content License. Subject to Licensee’s on­going compliance with Section 3.2 and all other terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor grants to Licensee a non-exclusive, transferable and sublicensable license, during the License Term, to reproduce, perform, display, transmit and distribute the Licensed Content on the Licensee Site and Related Media intended for use by any individuals in any area. The foregoing includes the right to permit others to use and redistribute the Licensed Content for any use, subject to no Terms of Use. Licensee is granted the right to allow other people to use the Licensed Content.
perturbation.explanation: The terms of the Content License were significantly changed and creates a legal contradiction within the license agreement. Changing from exclusive, non-transferable, and non-sublicensable to non-exclusive, transferable, and sublicensable directly changes who owns the license to use the content. Changing the area that the content can be distributed in affects Licensor’s right to limit the content in the region and greatly expands the terms and conditions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Copyright Law, specifically regarding exclusive rights granted to copyright holders and the enforceability of license agreements.
